ruleset.name: Error Prone
ruleset.description: Rules to detect constructs that are either broken, extremely confusing or prone to runtime errors.

rule.name: AvoidTrailingComma
rule.message: Avoid trailing commas in object or array literals
rule.description: This rule helps improve code portability due to differences in browser treatment of trailing commas in object or array literals.

property.name: xpath
allowObjectLiteral
property.description: Allow a trailing comma within an object literal

property.name: allowArrayLiteral
property.description: Allow a trailing comma within an array literal

rule.name: EqualComparison
rule.message: Use '==='/'!==' to compare with true/false or Numbers
rule.description: Using == in condition may lead to unexpected results, as the variables are automatically casted to be of the same type. The === operator avoids the casting.

rule.name: InnaccurateNumericLiteral
rule.message: The numeric literal ''{0}'' will have at different value at runtime.
rule.description: The numeric literal will have a different value at runtime, which can happen if you provide too much precision in a floating point number. This may result in numeric calculations being in error.
